When you die, you appear in a cinema with a number of other people who look like you.
You find out that they are your previous reincarnations, and soon you all begin watching your next life on the big screen.
You can see in detail the events that will occur in your next life, but you're unable to interact with the movie.
You wish you could take this knowledge into your next life, but you know you can't.
You don't even remember any of your other past lives besides the one you just lived.
You are shocked to learn that you have been both male and female in past lives, both rich and poor, and have died both young and old.
The most surprising life you lived was as royalty in a middle eastern country.
You were a princess who had her pick of men.
You married a man you didn't love, but who was a decent person and an excellent king.
It was enough for you to know that your husband would take good care of your people.
Eventually, you grew to love him because of his kindness and generosity.
You watched your movie life and learned that you would soon be reincarnated as a man in Japan.
You were excited about the possibilities, but you worried about your family you had just left behind.
Would you ever cross paths with them?
And if you did, would you feel a connection with them?
Your movie ended and you were forced to leave the theatre.
You knew that at any moment, your memories of what you just saw would be gone.
That was going to be a relief for a few reasons, but you desperately wished to hang on to the memories of the important things.
You didn't want to make the same mistakes again.
You went to a gorgeous lake to watch the sun meet the horizon.
You had a feeling that as soon as the sun was gone, you would be starting your new life.
The sun set, and as it did, you experienced a blinding light and great pressure all over your body.
You were being born!
Your new parents were so excited to meet you.
Since your life movie was so recent, you had some feelings of deja vu.
You couldn't quite place it, but this experience was familiar.
Your parents told you they would give you the best life a boy could ever have, and you believed them.
Seeing the love and promise in their eyes meant that your next life movie would have a happy ending.
